subs.text: September 15
@CatherineOmega @beanjammin I had hoped the plain fizzy water would replace the poisonous fizzy water, since I thought maybe it was the bite that I craved. It was partially true, so no regrets.
subs.rawText: @CatherineOmega @beanjammin I had hoped the plain fizzy water would replace the poisonous fizzy water, since I thought maybe it was the bite that I craved. It was partially true, so no regrets.

subs.text: @beanjammin That worked for a while, and might one day again. I haven’t made fizzy water for a couple of months, I’m not sure why, but up until then I had hoped it would replace Coca-Cola. It didn’t, but my water intake did increase significantly. [link]
subs.rawText: @beanjammin That worked for a while, and might one day again. I haven’t made fizzy water for a couple of months, I’m not sure why, but up until then I had hoped it would replace Coca-Cola. It didn’t, but my water intake did increase significantly. https://t.co/Z6TaztYjVJ

subs.text: In a previous relationship, my then-girlfriend gave me carte blanche to take candids of her, but it felt like the pressure to take a good shot was too high, so I only took two or three.
subs.rawText: In a previous relationship, my then-girlfriend gave me carte blanche to take candids of her, but it felt like the pressure to take a good shot was too high, so I only took two or three.

subs.text: (I 100% put the pressure on myself. I was never asked to take a good shot. It was just something I thought I had to do.)

subs.text: Whenever I see photos of someone at a food festival or a food court and all the food they ate, I assume they only took one or two bites, since it’s almost always an incredible amount of food that one person can’t possibly eat on their own. [link]
subs.rawText: Whenever I see photos of someone at a food festival or a food court and all the food they ate, I assume they only took one or two bites, since it’s almost always an incredible amount of food that one person can’t possibly eat on their own. https://t.co/UJ0Tpoyj0u

subs.text: I also think: “Should I bother going? I’ve had a pretty good experience just looking at the photos of of the food.”
subs.rawText: I also think: “Should I bother going? I’ve had a pretty good experience just looking at the photos of of the food.”

subs.text: I think the same thing when I see people posting their travel photos. “Why bother going now? I’m just going to see the same things I already saw.”
subs.rawText: I think the same thing when I see people posting their travel photos. “Why bother going now? I’m just going to see the same things I already saw.”

subs.text: September 12

@Bill2K MLB does recaps (3-4 minute highlight packages) and the 7-8 minute condensed games, and they’re really good, but they’re still never as good as Blue Jays in 30. It feels like something to make time for and eat snacks while watching.
subs.rawText: @Bill2K MLB does recaps (3-4 minute highlight packages) and the 7-8 minute condensed games, and they’re really good, but they’re still never as good as Blue Jays in 30. It feels like something to make time for and eat snacks while watching.

subs.text: After every Toronto Blue Jays game, Sportsnet (the TV network owned by the same parent company as the baseball team) produces a half-an-hour distillation called Blue Jays in 30. I want that for every event that’s 3 hours or longer.
subs.rawText: After every Toronto Blue Jays game, Sportsnet (the TV network owned by the same parent company as the baseball team) produces a half-an-hour distillation called Blue Jays in 30. I want that for every event that’s 3 hours or longer.

subs.text: @BombasticDave @dlbno Of course. I also have no knowledge of or plans to, nor a desire to, implement a single misfortune, much less 6 misfortunes. All I’m stating are the odds of them happening, no more, no less.
subs.rawText: @BombasticDave @dlbno Of course. I also have no knowledge of or plans to, nor a desire to, implement a single misfortune, much less 6 misfortunes. All I’m stating are the odds of them happening, no more, no less.

subs.text: @dlbno For that to happen, the Royal Family would have to fall victim to 6 separate misfortunes and would be unable to reign. But that will never happen. 3 misfortunes? That’s possible. 5 misfortunes? There’s an outside chance. But 6 misfortunes? I’d like to see that.
subs.rawText: @dlbno For that to happen, the Royal Family would have to fall victim to 6 separate misfortunes and would be unable to reign. But that will never happen. 3 misfortunes? That’s possible. 5 misfortunes? There’s an outside chance. But 6 misfortunes? I’d like to see that.

subs.text: I went to bed last night angry and sad about how unfair it was that I didn’t get to see my mother for over a year and a half before she died, but glad at all the time I had to talk with her up until the end.
subs.rawText: I went to bed last night angry and sad about how unfair it was that I didn’t get to see my mother for over a year and a half before she died, but glad at all the time I had to talk with her up until the end.

subs.text: Anyway, if you need me to be angry and sad about something, it’ll have to compete with that.
subs.rawText: Anyway, if you need me to be angry and sad about something, it’ll have to compete with that.

subs.text: Overhearing a conversation where a guy introduced himself to a woman, he says he likes her shirt, and they’re talking about the concert she’s going to. Now he’s deciding whether he should go to the concert now. That’s how it happens, I guess.

subs.text: September 5

My handsome heroism last night at the Wu-Tang Clan concert was to zip up the backpack of a quite intoxicated woman. (I wonder how long she went with it open. It takes Torontonians a really long time to point something like that out.) I got a friendly pat on the shoulder for that.

subs.text: @Kimli I made a note about it for when it comes up in Timehop, because of how often I don’t remember what the hell I was talking about a year (or years) later, but otherwise, thank you so much for the compliment!
